column4: Question... has anyone gotten E17 working in Dapper? If so, how?
i found a script that downloaded/compiled E17 from CVS (i think) it worked then.. a little. :P
I used that same script. And I suppose it worked "a little" also. But I need "totally," otherwise I can't use the danged WM, heh.
the script worked great.. it was E that had the issues.
i dident find it that impressive really.
Could you direct me to this script, then?
There's several out there, and perhaps I just wasn't using the best one.
it was on the E17 site  last i looked. that was 2 mo. ago.
i doubt it.
easy_e17.sh  was the script i used :P

Hmm, I don't hold out much hope then. Blast... all I really want is a really nice replacement for Metacity. I'm sick and tired of how slow and bloated it is. Not to mention those ugly black rectangles :/
try 'sawfish' then.
can I just apt-get that?
and i TOTALLY agree on the rectangles.
yea. ya could just isntall sawfish, and run the gnome panel. :P
I'll give that a whirl. Thanks!
Oh, and is there anywhere in the Conf-editor where I -can- turn off the black rectangles?
not that i have EVER seen
Arghh... I know, I looked for about an hour once. Heh.
welcome to the GNOME (we are the boss of you!) world. :P

Maybe you could answer one more thing that I've wondered about recently? What's the implication of the "LTS" moniker? What service are we actually talking about here? Canonical phone support, or what?
no clue there.. Im my own tech support. :P

I've found that LTS doesn't really mean anything outside of the norm. The standard forum help, IRC help, and wiki help that every other distro I've ever used gets. Now, if Canonical actually had free phone support, that would be something...
